devdoc.author: Joseph Reed
devdoc.details: This contract's goal is to make it easy for anyone to add utility to their cryptocurrency wallet through      the use of delegates. Delegates can transfer funds out of the wallet but cannot add or remove other delegates.

params.delegate: The address of the new delegate

addDelegate(address).return: True if the delegate was successfully added

params.token: The token to fetch the balance of. address(0x0) == native ether

balanceOf(address).return: The balance of the specified token

params.callAddress: The address of the token to transfer

call(address,bytes).return: success returns true if the call throws no errors. returnData contains the returned result of the call

getDelegates().return: An address array of all current delegates

params.i: The index from which to fetch the delegate address

params.delegate: The delegate address from which to grab the index

params._owner: The address that owns the wallet

params.delegate: The address of an existing delegate

removeDelegate(address).return: True if the delegate was successfully removed

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred
params.token: The address of the token to transfer

transfer(address,address,uint256).return: True if the transfer was successful

devdoc.title: DelegatedWallet Contract

addDelegate(address).notice: //////////////////////// Owner Functions ////////////////////////Add a new delegate to the list of delegates

balanceOf(address).notice: //////////////////////// Getter Functions ////////////////////////Gets the balance of the provided token

getDelegates().notice: This function is for easily fetching the current list of delegates

index(uint256).notice: Fetch a delegate address at a particular index

indexOf(address).notice: Fetch the index of a particular delegate address. Note: if the index returns '0',          it must be called in conjuction with isDelegate() due to '0' being a default return value

initialize(address).notice: Initializes the wallet. Uses 'initialize()' instead of a constructor to make use of the clone          factory at https://github.com/optionality/clone-factory. In general, 'initialize()' should be           called directly following it's deployment through the use of a factory.

isDelegate(address).notice: Determine if a given address is a delegate of this wallet

removeDelegate(address).notice: Remove an existing delegate from the list of delegates

totalDelegates().notice: Get the current total number of delegates
